89.heading: Simon and Schuster.

90.heading: Simon & Schuster.
90.title: Janet & Me : an Illustrated Story of Love and Loss
90.author: Stan Mack.
notes: Summary: Stan Mack follows his eighteen-year relationship with Janet Bode, a lighthearted fling that beat the odds to become an enduring love affair. The only thing they couldn't beat was cancer. As Janet and Stan confront the jagged terrain of cancer, then navigate the twilight of terminal illness, two portraits emerge: of a woman who faced her cancer the same way she lived her life, with guts and charm; and of the man who held her close and shared her struggle.
Format is text with interjected drawings and comics.

91.heading: Simon and Schuster.

92.heading: Simon & Schuster.

93.heading: Simon & Schuster.
93.title: Little Things : a Memoir in Slices
93.author: Jeffrey Brown.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): A collection of funny, poignant, and autobiographical short stories, Little Things looks at the aspects of daily life
friendship, illness, death, work, crushes, love, jealousy, and fatherhood

we take for granted. As each story loops into others, Jeffrey Brown shows how the smallest and seemingly most insignificant parts of everyday life can end up becoming the most meaningful. Brown's first full-length autobiographical book in several years, Little Things is also his most impressive, touching, and true.

245.heading: Simon Spotlight.

notes: Summary from SkyRiver): When Patrick catches a cold and can't go to the Stingray Brothers and Barnacle Bay Shrimp's Circus, SpongeBob, with a little ingenuity, brings the greatest show under the sea to him.

246.heading: Simon Spotlight.
246.title: Big Superhero Wish!

notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): When Timmy wishes the whole world was like a comic book, everyone becomes a hero! But Timmy soon learns that his wish didn't just make superheroes, it made super-villains, too!

247.heading: Simon Spotlight.
247.title: Discovering America
247.author: adapted by Kitty Richards ; from the script by Kate Boutilier ; illustrated by Don Cassity.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Grandpa Lou and Aunt Miriam have just come back from a cross-country trip across America, but they've forgotten to bring back Dil a "zoomineer". What's a baby to do? In an attempt to recover what's rightfully due his baby brother, Tommy and the babies set out on a cross-country trip of their own.

248.heading: Simon Spotlight.

249.heading: Simon Spotlight.

251.heading: Simon Spotlight.
251.title: For the Love of Bubbles
251.author: by Steven Banks ; illustrated by The Artifact Group.
notes: "Based on the TV series SpongeBob SquarePants created by Stephen Hillenburg as seen on Nickelodeon."
Summary (from SkyRiver): When SpongeBob suffers from amnesia, he searches for his identity while his friends search for him.

252.heading: Simon Spotlight.
252.title: Four's a Crowd
252.author: by J-P Chanda ; illustrated by Let's Draw Studio.
notes: "Based on the TV series Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles as seen on Fox and Cartoon Network."
"The four Turtles always work together as a team. But one day Raphael storms off in anger. Leonardo doesn't care
until he and his other two brothers confront devious enemies in a real fight...and get locked in a museum vault! Will Raphael show up before the Turtles run out of time

253.heading: Simon Spotlight.
253.title: Hands Off!
253.author: by David Lewman ; illustrated by C
notes: "Based on the TV series SpongeBob SquarePants created by Stephen Hillenburg"
Summary (from SkyRiver): Things get out of hand when SpongeBob entrusts his new bubble blower to his best friend, Patrick.

254.heading: Simon Spotlight.

254.author: Erica David, writer ; Warner McGee, artist ; Nick Sciacca, designer ; Kara Sargent, editor.

"A baby hawk is missing, and it's up to Diego to find her. This important mission turns extreme when a storm strikes!"

255.heading: Simon Spotlight.

notes: Cover title: Incredible Hulk Movie Novelization.

256.heading: Simon Spotlight.

and Phil is not happy. What are twins for if they can't do everything together?..."

257.heading: Simon Spotlight.
257.title: Jimmy Neutron Boy Genius
257.author: by Terry Collins ; illustrated by Patrick Spaziante.

Characters based on the motion picture Jimmy Neutron, boy genius.
Summary (from OCLC): When the adults of Retroville are abducted by aliens from the planet Yolkus, Jimmy Neutron and his friends set out to rescue them.

258.heading: Simon Spotlight.
258.title: Junk, Sweet Junk
258.author: by Molly Wigand ; pictures by Barry Goldberg.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Tommy, Chuckie, and Angelica help Tommy's grandfather throw away the useless junk he has accumulated, but the children find new uses for most of it and Grandpa decides it has value after all. Based on the animated television show Rugrats.

259.heading: Simon Spotlight.
259.title: Lean, Green, Smackdown Machine!
259.author: by Steve Murphy ; illustrated by Aristides Ruiz and Mike Giles.
notes: "There is going to be an amateur wrestling match at the Ronald Rump Civic Center, and Michelangelo and Raphael can't wait to enter. But when they see who their opponents are, they wonder if they'll make it out alive!"

260.heading: Simon Spotlight.
260.title: The Legend of Yaotl
260.author: by Steve Murphy ; based on the screenplay by Kevin Munroe ; illustrated by Patrick Spaziante.
notes: "Based on the film 'TMNT' by Imagi Animation Studios and Warner Bros."

Summary (from SkyRiver): When Yaotl, an evil man, opened an interplanetary portal thousands of years ago in search of a magical power, he released monsters and magic so dangerous that Earth was almost destroyed, and he is about to do it again.

261.heading: Simon Spotlight.
261.title: The Lost Scrolls : Fire
261.author: by Tom Mason and Dan Danko ; illustrated by Patrick Spaziante.

262.heading: Simon Spotlight.
262.title: Lovestruck!
262.author: by David Lewman ; illustrated by Jason Fruchter ; based on the teleplay by Butch Hartman, Steve Marmel, and Scott Fellows.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): When Timmy's attempt to make Trixie Tang his Valentine ends in humiliating failure, he wishes that he lived in a world without girls. POOF! He gets his wish, but with the boys and girls separated, love is disappearing, and it's killing Cupid! Will Timmy be able to get the men and women back together so the world will once again be filled with love?

263.heading: Simon Spotlight.
263.title: Marry Me, Smurfette!
263.author: by Peyo ; translated by Elizabeth Dennis Barton.
notes: Originally published in French as La Schtroumpfette et la Lune.
Summary (from OCLC): Smurfette promises to marry the Smurf who brings her the moon, setting off a series of events among her suitors.

264.heading: Simon Spotlight.
264.title: Meet Smurfette
264.author: by Peyo.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Gargamel the evil wizard creates a female Smurf to lure the Smurfs into a trap, but the Smurfs plan to show Smurfette what being a good Smurf is all about.

265.heading: Simon Spotlight.
265.title: Naughty Nautical Neighbors
265.author: by Annie Auerbach ; illustrated by Mark O'Hare.
notes: "Based on an original teleplay by Sherm Cohen, Aaron Springer, and Mr. Laurence."
Summary (from SkyRiver): Squidward tries to interfere with the friendship that SpongeBob and Patrick Star have for one another.

266.heading: Simon Spotlight.
266.title: Nickelodeon Rocket Power Joke Book
266.author: by Holly Kowitt.
notes: Based on the TV series Nickelodeon Rocket Power.

267.heading: Simon Spotlight.
267.title: Pizza Cats
267.author: by Gail Herman ; illustrated by Louie Del Carmen and James Peters.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): After making a huge mess in the storeroom, Tommy, Chuckie, Phil, and Lil persuade Pete to let three stray cats live in his pizza parlor.

268.heading: Simon Spotlight.
268.title: Rain, Rain, Smurf Away
268.author: by Peyo ; illustrated by Peyo.
notes: "Based on the story Le Schtroumpfeur de Pluie written by Peyo."

Summary (from SkyRiver): After days of endless rain, Handy Smurf decides to smurf a weather machine to make it go away, but what happens when Farmer Smurf and Poet Smurf get their hands on the machine and can't decide if it should be a sunny or rainy day?

269.heading: Simon Spotlight.
269.title: Ready for Laughs! : a Treasury of Undersea Humor
269.author: by David Lewman and David Fain.
notes: Based on the TV series SpongeBob SquarePants created by Stephen Hillenburg as seen on Nickelodeon.

270.heading: Simon Spotlight.
270.title: The Rugrats and the Zombies
270.author: by Sarah Willson ; illustrated by Barry Goldberg.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Tommy is afraid that his parents are turning into zombies when they start acting strangely following several sleepless nights.

271.heading: Simon Spotlight.
271.title: Rugrats Blast Off!
271.author: Stephanie St
notes: "A long car trip, what a bore! Then the Rugrats get the idea to pretend they're on a mission in outer space."

272.heading: Simon Spotlight.
272.title: Rugrats in Paris : the Movie
272.author: adapted by Cathy East Dubowski and Mark Dubowski ; based on the script by David N
272.appears_in: Weiss & J. David Stem and Jill Gorey & Barbara Herndon and Kate Boutilier.
notes: Summary: "When Stu Pickles's Reptar invention for the Reptarland amusement park in Paris breaks, he must personally fix it. Once Stu and the entire Rugrats crew jet off, the City of Light will never be the same!"

273.heading: Simon Spotlight.
273.title: The Rugrats Versus the Monkeys
273.author: by Luke David ; illustrated by John Kurtz and Sandrina Kurtz.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): The Rugrats are menaced in a deep, dark wood by a group of escaped circus monkeys.

274.heading: Simon Spotlight.
274.title: Sabrina, the Teenage Witch : Dream Date
274.author: by Margo Lundell ; photographs by Don Cadette.
notes: "Based on characters appearing in Archie Comics."

275.heading: Simon Spotlight.
275.title: A Smurfin' Big Adventure
275.author: by Fern Alexander ; illustrated by Mel Milton.
notes: At head of title: The Smurfs.
Summary (from OCLC): When Gargamel chases the Smurfs through a portal to a strange land, they must figure out how to reopen it to return home and avoid being captured by the evil wizard.

276.heading: Simon Spotlight.
276.title: The Smurfin' Guide to the Smurfs
276.author: by Elizabeth Denis Barton ; based on Peyo's work.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): A guide to the Smurfs who live in Smurf Village, including Papa Smurf, Brainy Smurf, Jokey Smurf, and Smurfette, and describes their adventures as they outwit the evil sorceror Gargamel.

277.heading: Simon Spotlight.
277.title: Smurfs 2: the Smurfs in Paris
277.author: adapted by Farrah McDoogle ; illustrated by Dynamo Limited.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): The Smurfs head to Paris to rescue Smurfette from Gargamel, who's locked her up in order to get the secret spell that will turn the Naughties into true-blue Smurfs.

278.heading: Simon Spotlight.
278.title: SpongeBob and the Princess
278.author: by David Lewman ; illustrated by Clint Bond.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): When the driver of a noisy truck tells SpongeBob to expect a delivery of Princess Napkins the next day, Sponge Bob misunderstands and soon all of Bikini Bottom is gathered to meet the princess.

279.heading: Simon Spotlight.
279.title: SpongeBob Exposed! : the Insider's Guide to SpongeBob SquarePants
279.author: by Steven Banks.
notes: "Based on the TV series SpongeBob SquarePants created by Stephen Hillenburg as seen on Nickelodeon."

280.heading: Simon Spotlight.
280.title: SpongeBob Roundpants
280.author: adapted by Erica David ; illustrated by Dave Aikins.
notes: "Based on the teleplay by Luke Brookshier, Nate Cash, and Steven Banks."
Summary (from OCLC): Spongebob has problems with his new round pair of pants.

281.heading: Simon Spotlight.
281.title: Stormy Weather
281.author: by Molly Wigand ; illustrated by Barry Goldberg.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Babies comfort each other as a storm rages outside.

282.heading: Simon Spotlight.
282.title: Super Slam Turtles!
282.author: adapted by Jim Thomas ; illustrated by Patrick Spaziante.
notes: "Based on the original teleplay 'The golden puck' by Michael Ryan."
"Based on the TV series Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles"
Summary (from Skyriver): The Turtles try to recover a trophy which is stolen during a hockey game.

283.heading: Simon Spotlight.
283.title: Sweet Victory
283.author: by Sarah Willson ; illustrated by Peter Panas.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): When Tommy's mom decides sugar is bad for babies, his friends find ingenious ways to acquire sweets for him.

284.heading: Simon Spotlight.
284.title: The Ultimate Rugrats Fan Book
284.author: by Jefferson Graham.
notes: "Includes episode guide, show trivia, actor photos, and more!"

285.heading: Simon Spotlight.
285.title: Vacation!
285.author: adapted by Molly Wigand ; from the script by Jon Cooksey, Ali Marie Matheson, and Mark Palmer; illustrated by Barry Goldberg.

286.heading: Simon Spotlight.
286.title: Valentines for Everyone!
286.author: by Chris Gifford and Christine Ricci ; illustrated by Steve Savitsky.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver) Dora and Boots take a trip over Cupcake Mountain and across Chocolate Lake to deliver a Valentine's Day surprise to Dora's grandmother, and along the way, they see all of their friends exchanging valentine treats.

287.heading: Simon Spotlight.
287.title: What it Takes to be a Smurf
287.author: by Maggie Testa.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Heartfelt and hilarious guide to what it takes to be a member of the Smurf family."

288.heading: Simon Spotlight.
288.title: Where's Rocky
288.author: by Debra Mostow Zakarin ; illustrated by Barry Goldberg.
notes: (The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle and Friends)
Summary (from SkyRiver): A lift-the-flap book in which the reader can help Bullwinkle find Rocky while Natasha and Boris try to foil him at every turn.

289.heading: Simon Spotlight.
289.title: The World's Greatest Valentine
289.author: by Terry Collins ; illustrated by Mark O'Hare.
notes: "Based on the TV series SpongeBob SquarePants created by Stephen Hillenburg as seen on Nickelodeon."

Summary (from SkyRiver): SpongeBob makes the biggest, sweetest valentine ever for his best friend, Patrick, but when a herd of chocolate-eating scallops threaten its arrival, Patrick may ruin Valentine's Day for all of Bikini Bottom.

290.heading: Simon Spotlight Entertainment.
290.title: Sunny Side Down : a Collection of the Comic Tales of Mere Existence
290.author: Levni Yilmaz.

291.heading: Simon Steel.
291.title: Dictionnaire Encyclopédique de Héros et Auteurs de BD
291.author: Henri Filippini

294.heading: Simonacci, Matteo.
294.title: "The Meat"
294.author: story, Roberto Ricci ; art, Matteo Simonacci
294.appears_in: p. 22-27 in Heavy Metal, v. 32, no. 9 (Jan. 2009).

295.heading: Simonato, Enrico.
295.title: Il Mistero di Casanova
295.author: Enrico Lovato ; illustrazione di copertina e disegni, Enrico Simonato.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): A murder mystery set in the magical atmosphere of the Carnival of Venice. While the masks crowd the streets, a mysterious thief who calls himself Casanova, scored numerous thefts of jewelry. By combining appealing design and engaging story, the reader can read the stories with pleasure and effortlessly.

296.heading: Simonato, Enrico.
296.title: Rigoletto
296.author: adattamento, Enrico Lovato ; illustrazione di copertina e disegni, Enrico Simonato.
notes: Summary (from publisher via OCLC): "Una storia avvincente, ambientata a Mantova durante in Rinascimento, e ispirata alla celebre opera di Verdi. Intenso dramma di passione, tradimento, amore e vendetta con protagonista un buffone di corte."

297.heading: Simond, Anne-Marie, 1941-
297.title: "Hugues Rebell le Scandaleux"
297.author: François Rivière ; illustration de Anne Marie Simond
297.appears_in: text p. 67 in À Suivre, no. 5 (Juin 1978).

298.heading: Simond, Anne-Marie, 1941-
298.title: "La Vengeance d'un Inconnu"
298.author: une nouvelle d'Hugues Rebell ; illustrations de Anne Marie Simond
298.appears_in: text p. 68-71 in À Suivre, no. 5 (Juin 1978).
